conbody.p: To upgrade from Eucalyptus 3.1 to Eucalyptus 3.2.0, follow the directions detailed in this section. To upgrade from any other version of Eucalyptus, you should first upgrade to 3.1 following the directions in the previous Install Guide, and then upgrade to 3.2.0 using these directions.

section.title: Setting Block Storage Manager
section.p: In Eucalyptus 3.2, there are a variety of new block storage managers. After upgrading, you must specify the block storage manager for each zone before you can connect to the storage backend, as follows:
The ebs_manager should be one of the following options:

ul.li: emc-vnx-flare31 - for EMC VNX Provider running FLARE v5.31

section.p: See Configure the Storage Controller for more information.

section.title: Finding Backup Files
section.p: The upgrade process creates a backup to /var/lib/eucalyptus/upgrade/eucalyptus.backup.<timestamp>. For example:
If the upgrade fails and needs to be reverted to your earlier version, you can find your preserved data in this directory.
